articles.author: Tom Wilson, Tom Westbrook
articles.description: Bitcoin rose 6% on Tuesday to to $35,198, its highest in nearly a year-and-a-half, on mounting speculation that an exchange-traded bitcoin fund is imminent.
articles.title: Bitcoin soars to near 18-month high as ETF speculation mounts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) union struck a General Motors (GM.N) assembly plant in Texas on Tuesday that builds the U.S. automaker's profitable full-size sport utility vehicles, in another significant expansion of the strike.
articles.title: UAW expands strike against GM, walking out of Texas SUV plant

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Mac computer and iPhone maker Apple (AAPL.O) on Tuesday will announce plans to make parts, tools and documentation needed to repair its products available to independent repair shops and consumers nationwide, at fair and reasonable prices, the White House said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Apple to make tools and parts to fix phones, computers available nationwide - White House

articles.author: Stephen Nellis, Max Cherney
articles.description: Nvidia (NVDA.O) dominates the market for artificial intelligence computing chips. Now it is coming after Intel’s longtime stronghold of personal computers.
articles.title: Exclusive: Nvidia to make Arm-based PC chips in major new challenge to Intel

articles.author: Dan Levine, Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: Closing arguments are set to begin on Tuesday in the first U.S. trial over allegations that Tesla's (TSLA.O) Autopilot driver assistant feature led to a death, and its results could help shape similar cases across the country.
articles.title: Tesla Autopilot fatality case to soon reach California jury

articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Qualcomm (QCOM.O) on Tuesday gave details about a chip for Microsoft (MSFT.O) Windows-based laptops that it claims will be faster at some tasks than Apple's (AAPL.O) chips for Mac computers.
articles.title: Qualcomm unveils new PC laptop chip with AI features for 2024

articles.author: David French
articles.description: Exxon Mobil (XOM.N) and Chevron (CVX.N) are flush with cash yet their acquisition targets are taking stock as the only form of payment, an arrangement that allows the two largest U.S. energy companies to clinch transformative deals despite volatile oil and gas prices.
articles.title: Analysis: Cash-rich Exxon, Chevron use stock for mega deals amid energy market jitters

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel's military said it was preparing for "unrelenting attacks" to dismantle Hamas while former U.S. President Barack Obama warned that "any Israeli military strategy that ignores the human costs could ultimately backfire."
articles.title: Israel promises 'unrelenting attacks' on Hamas; US, Obama urge caution

articles.author: Janis Laizans
articles.description: An elderly Israeli hostage who was released by Hamas overnight said she had been beaten by militants when she was abducted and taken to Gaza on Oct. 7, but was then treated well during her two-week captivity in the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: Freed Israeli hostage says 'I've been through hell'

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel, Diane Bartz, Nate Raymond
articles.description: Dozens of U.S. states are suing Meta Platforms (META.O) and its Instagram unit, accusing them of fueling a youth mental health crisis by making their social media platforms addictive.
articles.title: Meta's Instagram linked to depression, anxiety, insomnia in kids - US states' lawsuit
